Articles.Title: Xamarin.Forms 4.5 Stable Release Available!
Articles.Description: Every new release of Xamarin.Forms contains dozens of improvements. Today, we are thrilled to share that Xamarin.Forms 4.5 is now available bringing you AndroidX, new capabilities for creating responsive UI, and controls ‚Äúin the box‚Äù to speed your development. Let‚Äôs look at what is new in Xamarin.Forms 4.5 with several features to get excited about!
Articles.Author: David Ortinau

Articles.Title: Xamarin.Forms: Native API Acces with Dependency Injection
Articles.Description: Dependency Injection is a great technique for leveraging native code in the context of your shared code. In Xamarin.Forms you typically create a custom renderer which gives you native access. If you need to run some native code from the shared context you can easily do this with the built-in Dependency Injection tooling.
Articles.Author: Andrew Hoefling

Articles.Title: How To Confirm Exit in Android with Xamarin Forms
Articles.Description: Ever hit the navigation bar back button when using an Android app and have it fully exit the app and drop you back on your home screen? I think all Android users have encountered this a few times. It is a frustrating and counter-productive experience. Let‚Äôs make sure your app has better UX by using a simple confirmation dialog!
Articles.Author: Dylan Berry

Articles.Title: Fill PDF Forms on the Go with Import and Export Form Data Support in Xamarin PDF Viewer
Articles.Description: Are you frequently filling PDF forms in your Xamarin mobile application? Are you annoyed at entering basic details like your name, email address, and phone number again and again? Then Syncfusion have a solution to your problem.
Articles.Author: Ramkumar Ravy

Articles.Title: Cross platform tray bar applications with Xamarin.Forms
Articles.Description: Ever wondered how to create a tray/menu item bar application? It turns out you can do just that with Xamarin.Forms and Konrad shows you how!
Articles.Author: Konrad M√ºller

Articles.Title: TaskLoaderView & Lottie Best Friends Forever
Articles.Description: Lottie is a cross-platform library created by Twitter, then wrapped in a cool Xamarin.Forms view by Martijn van Dijk, allowing you to bring a unique identity to your app with animations. TaskLoaderView is a state container from Sharpnado, and in this post, Jean-Marie shows you how you can combine the two to bring exciting animations to your app depending on the state.
Articles.Author: Jean-Marie Alfonsi

Articles.Title: Using AutoMapper in your Xamarin Forms apps
Articles.Description: Whenever you are creating a larger Xamarin Forms application, you usually end up with different models representing similar data but for different areas of your app. For example, you will get a minimalist Data Transfer Object (DTO) from your backend, which you might copy into another app-internal model or directly to the View Model representing the data displayed on your view. And this is where AutoMapper will help you out and prevent you from writing all that copy code.
Articles.Author: Mark Allibone

Articles.Title: Exploring Grial UI Kit in Xamarin Forms
Articles.Description: Grial UI Kit provides XAML templates, custom controls, helpers and resources that accelerate the creation of Xamarin.Forms apps. In this article, Charlin explores the Grial UI Kit, talking about how to use it, pricing and some personal feedback.
Articles.Author: Charlin Agramonte

Articles.Title: Merge Conflict: 190: The Creation of Appstat with Frank
Articles.Description: Frank decided to do his holiday hack in mid-February and build an entire app in a weekend. What is it? What was his inspiration? How did he build it? How is he distributing and promoting it?
Articles.Author: Merge Conflict
